> My choice for you is to go with Emma,a free open source tool which just 
> needs the target to be written in your build.xml

Cobertura is my pick. Emma offers more analytical features, but IMHO, 
it's a bit too clunky and overwrought. Besides, Cobertura's code is 
ridiculously easy to customize; last year I added a feature that would 
allow you to see which tests exercised a given line of code by clicking 
on the line in the Cobertura output, and it took about a day to write.
